page.title: 16Shooting in Leighfield
page.content: In Priors Coppice (830055) there is no organised shooting only rough shooting but the 140 acres of Launde Park Wood (803038), as well as 200 acres of farmland to the north is part of a syndicated shoot. The syndicate has 10 guns and shoots occur once a fortnight during the season giving a total of about 8 days.A gamekeeper is employed in the wood and he visits twice daily to check that everything is alright. Pheasants are fed all over the wood and about 750 birds are bred and released each year. The shoot is mainly for pheasant but about 40 woodcock and a few pigeons are also shot each year.
